com.mapdigit.gis.geometry

Class GeoLatLng

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoPoint
      • com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoLatLng

  • public class GeoLatLng
extends GeoPoint
    GeoLatLng is a point in geographical coordinates longitude and latitude.
    © Copyright 2009 Guidebee Pty Ltd.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoPoint

        x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeoLatLng()
      Constructs and initializes a point at the origin (0, 0) of the geographical coordinate space.

      Constructs and initializes a point at the specified (lat,lng) location in the coordinate space.

      Constructs and initializes a point at the specified (lat,lng) location in the coordinate space.
      GeoLatLng(GeoLatLng p)
      Constructs and initializes a point with the same location as the specified GeoLatLng object.

    • Method Detail

      • lat

        public double lat()
        Returns the latitude coordinate in degrees, as a number between -90 and +90. If the unbounded flag was set in the constructor, this coordinate can be outside this interval.
        Returns:
        the latitude coordinate in degrees.

      • lng

        public double lng()
        Returns the longitude coordinate in degrees, as a number between -180 and +180. If the unbounded flag was set in the constructor, this coordinate can be outside this interval.
        Returns:
        the longitude coordinate in degrees.

      • latRadians

        public double latRadians()
        Returns the latitude coordinate in radians, as a number between -PI/2 and +PI/2. If the unbounded flag was set in the constructor, this coordinate can be outside this interval.
        Returns:
        the latitude coordinate in radians.

      • lngRadians

        public double lngRadians()
        Returns the longitude coordinate in radians, as a number between -PI and +PI. If the unbounded flag was set in the constructor, this coordinate can be outside this interval.
        Returns:
        the longitude coordinate in radians.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Determines whether or not two points are equal. Two instances of GeoLatLng are equal if the values of their x and y member fields, representing their position in the coordinate space, are the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class GeoPoint
        Parameters:
        obj - an object to be compared with this GeoLatLng
        Returns:
        true if the object to be compared is an instance of GeoLatLng and has the same values; false otherwise.

      • distance

        public static double distance(GeoLatLng pt1,
              GeoLatLng pt2)
        Returns the distance, in meters, from this point to the given point. By default, this distance is calculated given the default equatorial earth radius of 6378137 meters. The earth is approximated as a sphere, hence the distance could be off as much as 0.3%, especially in the polar extremes.
        Parameters:
        pt1 - the first point.
        pt2 - the other point.
        Returns:
        the distance, in kilo meters.

      • distanceFrom

        public double distanceFrom(GeoLatLng other)
        Returns the distance, in meters, from this point to the given point. By default, this distance is calculated given the default equatorial earth radius of 6378137 meters. The earth is approximated as a sphere, hence the distance could be off as much as 0.3%, especially in the polar extremes.
        Parameters:
        other - the other point.
        Returns:
        the distance, in Kilo meters.

                GeoLatLng pt2,
                GeoLatLng pt3)
        Calculate bearing
        Parameters:
        pt1 - first location.
        pt2 - 2nd location.
        pt3 - 3rd location.
        Returns:
        the bearing angle (from 0 to 360).

      • azimuthTo

        public static double azimuthTo(GeoLatLng from,
               GeoLatLng to)
        Calculates the azimuth between the two points according to the ellipsoid model of WGS84. The azimuth is relative to true north. The Coordinates object on which this method is called is considered the origin for the calculation and the Coordinates object passed as a parameter is the destination which the azimuth is calculated to. When the origin is the North pole and the destination is not the North pole, this method returns 180.0. When the origin is the South pole and the destination is not the South pole, this method returns 0.0. If the origin is equal to the destination, this method returns 0.0. The implementation shall calculate the result as exactly as it can. However, it is required that the result is within 1 degree of the correct result.
        Parameters:
        from - - the Coordinates of the origin
        to - - the Coordinates of the destination
        Returns:
        the azimuth to the destination in degrees. Result is within the range [0.0 ,360.0).
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - - if the parameter is null

      • toUrlValue

        public java.lang.String toUrlValue(int precision)
        Returns a string that represents this point in a format suitable for use as a URL parameter value, separated by a comma, without whitespace. By default, precision is returned to 6 digits, which corresponds to a resolution to 4 inches/ 11 centimeters. An optional precision parameter allows you to specify a lower precision to reduce server load.
        Parameters:
        precision - the precision of the output.
        Returns:
        string that represents this point.
